title: AI Chip Export Controls: Mechanism and Market Impact
summary: Analysis of U.S. export control rules on advanced AI chips, their enforcement mechanisms, and downstream effects on China-based model training capacity.

EVID.rationale: Multiple government documents and industry filings cited.

MECH.rationale: Export licensing mechanism clearly described with BIS rule references.

INC.rationale: Incentives for circumvention documented via court filings.

RISK.rationale: Supply chain disruption risks quantified in analyst reports.

SPEC.rationale: Specific chip models (H100, A100), companies, and dates referenced.

claims.text: The October 2023 BIS rule update restricted export of chips with total processing performance above 4800 TOPS.

source.title: BIS Export Control Rule Oct 2023
source.excerpt: ...any integrated circuit with TPP exceeding 4800 TOPS is subject to license requirement...

claims.text: NVIDIA shipped approximately $2.5B in H100 chips to Middle Eastern distributors in Q3 2023 before the rule change.

source.title: NVIDIA 10-Q Q3 2023
source.excerpt: Data center revenue of $14.5B included significant international shipments...

claims.notes: Regional breakdown inferred from analyst commentary.

claims.text: Some Chinese firms have begun acquiring restricted chips through third-party shell entities in Southeast Asia.
claims.notes: Reuters reporting referenced but no named entities per publication policy.

claims.text: Model training throughput at major Chinese AI labs is estimated to have declined 18â€“22% following the 2023 rule.
claims.notes: Analyst estimate from SemiAnalysis; not independently verified.
